parameters.name: FilePathName
parameters.description: Path and filename of the project file containing the macro

parameters.name: ModuleName
parameters.description: Name of the module in the macro

parameters.name: ProcedureName
parameters.description: Name of the procedure in the module

parameters.name: Options
parameters.description: Option as defined swRunMacroOption_e (supports VBA macros only)

parameters.name: Error
parameters.description: Error as defined by swRunMacroError_e (supports VBA macros only)

title: ISldWorks.RunMacro2
description: Runs a macro from a project file.
signature:
System.Boolean RunMacro2( 
   System.String
FilePathName
,
   System.String
ModuleName
,
   System.String
ProcedureName
,
   System.Int32
Options
,
   out System.Int32
Error
)

parameters.name: FilePathName
parameters.description: Path and filename of the project file containing the macro

parameters.name: ModuleName
parameters.description: Name of the module in the macro

parameters.name: ProcedureName
parameters.description: Name of the procedure in the module

parameters.name: Options
parameters.description: Option as defined swRunMacroOption_e (supports VBA macros only)

parameters.name: Error
parameters.description: Error as defined by swRunMacroError_e (supports VBA macros only)

returns: True if macro runs, false if not
remarks:
If you specify swRunMacroUnloadAfterRun for Options, then the macro is unloaded from the VBA IDE after running.
Use the path and filename of the compiled DLL for the FilePathName argument for a .NET macro. By default, the procedure is called
Main
in a C# macro. Because C# is case sensitive, you must specify
Main
for ProcedureName in this method.. See
Running a C# DLL from VBA
in the
Example
section.
Running a macro from an add-in application, standalone .
exe
, or VBA macro is supported. Running a .NET macro from a .NET macro is also supported, but only if both .NET macros were created using the same VSTA version.
See
SOLIDWORKS Macros
for details.
